help.title: User Guide
help.hero_subtitle: Complete guide to managing your vehicle fleet. Learn how to use every module of the system step by step.
help.overview_p1: FleetCore is a corporate fleet management system designed to track vehicles, drivers, maintenance, expenses, and contracts in one place. It is built for fleet managers, administrators, and drivers at large enterprises.
help.overview_p2: The system consists of the following main modules:
help.overview_vehicles_desc: Registry of all vehicles with full specifications, status tracking, and photo gallery
help.overview_drivers_desc: Driver profiles with license and medical certificate tracking
help.overview_maintenance_desc: Schedule and track all service and repair work
help.overview_expenses_desc: Record and categorize all fleet-related costs, including fuel
help.overview_contracts_desc: Manage leasing, insurance, rental and service contracts
help.overview_reports_desc: Analytics: TCO, fuel consumption, expense analysis, maintenance history
help.role_admin_desc: Full access: manage users, system settings, and all data
help.role_manager_desc: Manage vehicles, drivers, maintenance, contracts, expenses, and reports
help.role_driver_desc: View assigned vehicles, submit mileage readings, view own schedule
help.role_viewer_desc: Read-only access to dashboards and reports
help.dashboard_p1: The dashboard is the home page that gives you a quick overview of the entire fleet. It loads automatically when you sign in. All data updates in real time.
help.dashboard_widget_fleet_desc: Shows total vehicle count by status: Active, In Maintenance, Decommissioned
help.dashboard_widget_attention_desc: Alerts for overdue maintenance, expiring contracts, licenses, and medical certificates
help.dashboard_widget_expenses_desc: Chart showing expense breakdown by category for the last 6 months
help.dashboard_widget_maint_desc: Recent maintenance records and overall statistics
help.dashboard_widget_top_desc: Vehicles with the highest total expenses
help.howto_add: How to add a new record
help.vehicles_p1: The Vehicles section is the core registry of all fleet vehicles. Each vehicle has a detailed profile card with license plate, VIN, brand, model, year, status, and more.
help.vehicles_step_filter: Use the search bar and filters (status, brand, fuel type) to find specific vehicles
help.vehicles_step_click: Click on any row to open the vehicle detail page
help.vehicles_add_step1: Click the "Add Vehicle" button at the top of the vehicle list
help.vehicles_add_step2: Fill in the required fields: license plate, VIN, brand, model, year
help.vehicles_add_step3: Click "Save" to create the vehicle record
help.vehicle_detail_desc: Each vehicle has a detail page with multiple tabs. Click any tab to see the related data:
help.drivers_p1: The Drivers section stores all driver profiles, including personal information, license details, and medical certificate validity. Drivers can be assigned to one or more vehicles.
help.drivers_alert_desc: The system automatically tracks driver license and medical certificate expiry dates and shows warnings on the dashboard when they are about to expire.
help.mileage_p1: Mileage is tracked through the vehicle detail page. Each entry records the odometer reading at a specific date.
help.mileage_step1: Open the vehicle detail page and switch to the "Mileage" tab
help.mileage_step2: The table shows all mileage entries with date, reading, delta, and source
help.mileage_step3: New readings are validated: the value must be greater than or equal to the previous entry
help.mileage_note_desc: The delta column shows how many kilometers were driven between the current and the previous reading. This helps spot abnormal jumps.
help.maintenance_p1: The Maintenance section lets you plan, track, and complete all service and repair work for your fleet. Each record is linked to a specific vehicle.
help.maint_status_scheduled_desc: Work is planned but not started yet
help.maintenance_add_step1: Click "Add Maintenance" on the maintenance list page
help.maintenance_add_step2: Select the vehicle and fill in the type, title, scheduled date
help.maintenance_add_step3: Optionally add service provider, cost, and notes
help.expenses_p1: The Expenses section records all costs associated with your fleet. Every expense is linked to a vehicle and categorized for easy analysis.
help.expense_fuel_desc: When adding a fuel expense, additional fields appear: liters, price per liter, and mileage at refueling. This data is used in fuel consumption reports.
help.expense_add_step1: Click "Add Expense" on the expense list page
help.expense_add_step2: Select the vehicle, category, and enter the amount
help.expense_add_step3: For fuel expenses, fill in the liters and price per liter fields
help.contracts_p1: The Contracts section manages all agreements linked to vehicles: leasing, insurance, rental, warranty, and service contracts. The system tracks expiry dates and sends reminders.
help.contract_add_step1: Click "Add Contract" on the contract list page
help.contract_add_step2: Select the vehicle, contract type, contractor, dates, and amount
help.documents_p1: Documents can be attached to any entity in the system: vehicles, drivers, maintenance records, and contracts. Supported formats include images (JPG, PNG), PDF, Word, and Excel files up to 10 MB.
help.documents_upload_step1: Open the detail page of any vehicle, driver, maintenance record, or contract
help.documents_upload_step2: Scroll to the Documents section and drag a file onto the upload area, or click to browse
help.documents_upload_step3: Select the document type and click Upload
help.documents_formats_desc: JPG, PNG, PDF, Word (.doc, .docx), Excel (.xls, .xlsx). Maximum file size: 10 MB.
help.reports_p1: The Reports section provides fleet analytics. Select a report type, set the date range, and view the results. All reports can be exported.
help.report_tco_desc: Total cost of ownership per vehicle: purchase price + all expenses
help.report_fuel_desc: Fuel consumption per vehicle: total liters, cost, and number of refuels
help.report_expense_desc: Expense distribution by category with monthly trend charts
help.report_maint_desc: Full service history across the fleet: scheduled and unscheduled maintenance
help.reports_filters_desc: Each report has a date range filter. Use the start and end date pickers to narrow results to a specific period.
help.reports_export_desc: Click the export button on any report to download data as Excel (.xlsx) or CSV. PDF export is also available for some reports.
help.notifications_p1: FleetCore sends automatic notifications about important events. Notifications appear in the system and can also be delivered via email and Telegram.
help.notif_type_license: Driver license and medical certificate expiry alerts
help.settings_p1: Settings are available to administrators only. Here you can manage users, view the audit log, and update your profile.
help.settings_users_desc: View, create, edit, and deactivate user accounts. Assign roles (Admin, Fleet Manager, Driver, Viewer) to control access levels.
help.settings_audit_desc: A read-only log of all actions in the system: who created, edited, or deleted records, and when. Use filters to search by user, action type, or entity.
help.settings_profile_step1: Click your name in the top-right corner and select "Profile"
help.settings_profile_step2: Update your name or change your password
help.settings_lang_desc: Click the language icon in the top navigation bar to switch between English, Russian, Kazakh, and Turkish. Your preference is saved automatically.
help.tip_dark_mode_desc: Click the moon icon in the top bar to switch to dark mode. The setting is saved in your browser.
help.tip_filters_desc: All list pages have filters. Combine search, status, and date filters to quickly find what you need.
help.tip_keyboard_desc: Click on any row in a table to open the detail page. Use the sidebar to jump between modules.
help.tip_export_desc: Most list pages and all reports support export to Excel and CSV for further analysis in spreadsheets.
